Name: Kick The Bomb
Description:
The most explosive card game! Challenge your friends and be the last one standing.

Kick The Bomb is a party game where players have to throw (kick)/place bombs (remote mines, grenades & nuke) to each other using their cards. Players takes turns using different types of actions (defend, attack, draw a card, detonate) until there is only one player remaining, that player is declared the winner.

Name: Biomes
Description:
Biomes is a board game where you will expand your lands and develop buildings to gain the most points by the end of the game.

The game

A game for 1-4 players, draft from the available tiles to lay and connect new biomes. Once you have created an area that can be developed, build buildings to gain resources, and gain points.

Name: The Dukes of Hazzard
Description:
An extremely fun and rare board game, based on the famous TV series.  It was released in Greece during the 80's by Tjitji Toys. It can be played from 2-4 players. 
Before start, each player gets 30$ from the bank. Then, everyone in his turn, roll the 2 dices (the usual one and the colorfull one). When you roll the usual one, your move your pawn (General Lee) the exact number on the board.  Then you roll the colorfull one and you move the pawn with the police car.  The police car can be moved back and forth. When a player reaches a spot where stands another player,  he must pay him 5 dollars and stay in the previous spot.  When the police car hits another player,  the player who has been hitted,  must pay 5 dollars to the bank.  In case, that a player must pay the bank and he has no money, as a result he returns to the starting point. 
Furthermore, when a player reaches a spot with a question mark on it,  he must take a card and follow its rules. 
The winner is the player who reaches the finish line, with the exact number on the dice.

—user summary

Name: Tang Garden: Big Box
Description:
Tang Garden with all Expansions (Golden Age, Ghost Stories and Seasons and every other Promo excluding the Golden Cat).

The Tang dynasty was considered the first golden age of the classical and now iconic Chinese gardens. Emperor Xuanzong built the magnificent imperial Garden of the Majestic Clear Lake as an homage of life itself and from where he ruled. Players will act as Imperial Garden Designers and they will be called to build the most incredible garden while balancing the elements of Nature.

Tang Garden is a Zen-like game that will take you to the first golden age of China, where players will progressively build a garden by creating the landscape, placing the scenery and projecting their vision through vertical panoramas. During the construction, noblemen will visit the garden to admire the surroundings and the way the natural elements coexist in the most breathtaking scenery humankind has ever laid their eyes upon.

Players will take turns by playing one of the two actions available in the game:

1) Placing tiles and matching the elements to increase their personal nature balance and unlock more character miniatures.

By balancing the nature elements on the player boards, players will attract new characters into the garden. On each player turn, if the elements are balanced, the player will have to choose one miniature from the ones available and finally decide which one of the characters will be placed in the garden, orienting them towards their favorite background, while keeping the other with you to keep exploiting its ability.

2) Draw decoration cards and place one on the board to get prestige by completing collections.

Players will draw a quantity of cards based on the board situation and choose one to keep. Players will then have to place the chosen decoration in one of the available spots in the garden, creating a unique and seamless scenario that will never be the same.

During the game, by placing tiles on special parts of the board, you will be able to place a panorama tile, a new element that adds a never ending perspective for the visitors. Both small and big panoramas will be placed perpendicularly to the board by attaching it to the board insert by creating a seamless look on the four sides of the board. The Panoramas will interact with the characters at the end of the game by giving prestige points based on what your visitor sees and likes.

At the end of the game, the player with the most prestige will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: バトルオブジパング (Battle of Zipangu)
Airships and Automatons
Description:
In Airships and Automatons players play as an Automaton that can convert into an Airship and back again. They will be traveling around their city sheet completing tasks with dice rolls. Certain areas require the  player to be an Airship while other tasks require the player to be an Automaton. Further still, there are two spaces that can be used by either.

Players will have to move each turn, 1 space as an Automaton or up to 2 spaces as an Airship. They will use their dice to Convert, move an extra space or two, or activate their area of the City. Players also gain powers and create combos by completing tasks in the City.

Opportunities arise for players who are playing quickly to trigger a bonus by moving back into Area 1 of the City which allows all players to Convert, but the triggering player to earn a special bonus.

The game plays over 12 revolutions of the City sheet. Each revolution will last a number of rounds determined by the players. Will they play fast? Will they play slow to do all of the actions? The choices are plenty!

Scoring is done for each area with the players having a grand total at the end. The winning Automaton will have to master the clock as well as plan ahead each time focusing to maximize areas so they can outscore their rivals.

Airships and Automatons can be played solo or with up to 4 players. There are suggestions for how to combine the airships and automaton cards, but with this print and play format, players can create any number of combinations they choose. Additionally, printing out a set of cards for each player allows them to choose their own combinations and see if their own skill can beat their opponents when using the same Airship/Automaton combination!

Get ready to roll and write in this all new Steampunk game!

—description from the designer

Name: Double Dose
Description:
Double Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. It's a sequel to Dose that's playable alone or in conjunction with the original game. Compared to basic Dose, Double Dose includes cards that make players reveal truths, perform dares, and share their deepest, darkest history. It also integrates an online function that allows players to reload random rule, dare, truth, and never-have-I-ever suggestions via the website: dosecards.com.

Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.

Name: セーノ (Seeno)
Description:
ã‚»ãƒ¼ãƒŽ (Seeno) is a two player card game from Japan. Using the theme and gameplay of rock, scissors, paper, the game has three characters, ã‚°ãƒ¼ (GÅ«), ãƒãƒ§ã‚­ (Choki), ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã§ (PÄ de). Each player gets six cards, numbered 1 to 3, which count as hits to win draws. These three battle it out but also have special abilities on action cards. A quick game that children and adults can pick up easily.
user summary

Name: Nexum Galaxy: Asteroids
Description:
In the Nexum Galaxy "Asteroids" Expansion you will find a greater depth of gameplay in the story and asymmetric features of the Civilizations, with technologies, exploration, new resources, wormholes that will connect us to other Sectors, etc.

With this expansion, Nexum Galaxy becomes a 4X game (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate).

It also introduces an asymmetry in factions, technology, new resources. It increases replayability by adding new Systems to those included in the base game, as well as Event and AI cards.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: PHONEY WAR
Description:
PHONEY WAR is a WWII war game.
Play as West Allies, Germans or Soviets in the two modes of play:
2 Players: Prelude to War
3 Players: Race to Berlin
Both game modes use most of the same rules and components.

Name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile
Description:
Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile

Three more mighty armies for your arsenal! The troops and tanks of the innumerable Astra Militarum are ready and willing to fight for the Emperor! The dark and twisted Drukhari are poised to spring out of the warp to loot and plunder across the galaxy. Chaos marches to war with hordes of Daemons from each of the four mighty lords.

Alongside these three forces are new Treasures like the Shadowsword tank and notable monsters like Rotigus to make your Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 game even more massive!

—description from the publisher

Name: Nova-Raiders
Description:
A fast-paced, competitive, space challenge for 2-4 players.

You are a Nova Raider, part prospector and part pirate, in this space age race for riches. Compete with other Raiders to collect the valuable energy crystals surrounding an unstable star. Grab as much as you can before the expanding star consumes everything in its path, including you.

Use your dice to  Hop between Teleports or fly around the Orbit Rings to collect Energy Crystals. Gather these crystals under your ship and try to bring them back to your Space Dock before somebody Hijacks your cargo.  The time track is constantly moving forward, triggering the addition of more energy and the dangerous expansion of the star. The expanding star consumes everything in its path, until it goes Super-Nova, ending the game. Whoever collects the most energy before the Star goes Super-Nova will win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Viridian: Final Reckoning
Description:
The sprawling Great Bear Rainforest of British Columbia has remained untouched by humankind. It’s thousand year old red cedars and 300 foot Sitka spruces shadow uncharted paths. The forest has grown wild and unscathed. Until now.

In humanity’s quest for wealth and resources they have pushed further and further into the dense overgrowth. Only this time they’ve traversed too far. In the depths of this Canadian forest lies the Viridian, an army of animals sworn to protect their home. Once content to hide, these high functioning animals with human-like cognition have nowhere left to go. It’s time to fight.

The attack against the invading human forces is led by Viridian High Marshal Caal, a vicious, but aging gorilla. He has championed Viridian since his escape from the Vancouver Zoo and united a ragtag group of animals who were also seeking safety. The group became organized and strengthened under his leadership, but now he is looking for a successor. You, a young general, must join this fight.

Every game of Viridian: Final Reckoning represents a battle against the humans. Your goal is to defeat as many enemies as possible - place enough of your troops within striking distance to take them down. Every defeated enemy is another addition to your war resume. Additionally, every battle has specific goals you must meet in order to survive. Regardless of your score, if you do not meet the mission goal, you die. Not only are you battling for survival, but you’re also fighting to become the next leader of Viridian. The player with the highest score becomes the next Viridian High Marshal.

—description from the designer

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Path to Carcosa: Campaign Expansion
Description:
A repackaging of the Path to Carcosa cycle. All of the player cards for the cycle can be found in the Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion while all the encounter cards and campaign cards can be found in the Path to Carcosa Campaign Expansion.
—user summary

For weeks, the upcoming performance of The King in Yellow has been the talk of the town. But research into the play’s dark history has convinced you that something foul is at work. Disappearances. Suicides. Delusions. Insanity. Wherever The King in Yellow is performed, madness follows close behind. No connection has yet been proven, but that won’t stop you from searching for the truth.

Return to the second cycle of content for Arkham Horror LCG with The Path to Carcosa Campaign Expansion. Just like with the previous cycle, all campaign- and scenario-related cards for this "cycle" can be found in the Campaign Expansion. This is a fantastic opportunity for new fans of the game to experience its second full-length campaign, and for longtime fans to catch up on any parts they may have missed. Whether you want just one of the expansions or both, no Arkham fan will want to miss The Path to Carcosa!
—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Path to Carcosa: Investigator Expansion
Description:
A repackaging of the Path to Carcosa cycle. All of the player cards for the cycle can be found in the Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion while all the encounter cards and campaign cards can be found in the Path to Carcosa Campaign Expansion.
—user summary

"I cannot forget Carcosa where black stars hang in the heavens; where the shadow of men’s thoughts lengthen in the afternoon, when the twin suns sink into the lake of Hali; and my mind will bear for ever the memory of the Pallid Mask." –Robert W. Chambers, The King in Yellow

A new theater production is coming to Arkham all the way from Paris. Unsurprisingly, it's been all the rage in conversations among Arkham's socialites. But in your efforts to learn more about the play, you've uncovered a darker history. Disappearances. Suicides. Delusions. Insanity. Wherever The King in Yellow is performed, madness follows close behind…

In The Path to Carcosa, the second deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, it becomes your task to uncover the secrets of this unusual play. The expansion's two scenarios kick off The Path to Carcosa campaign with a trip to the Ward Theatre and an invitation to the formal dinner party hosted by cast and crew. But with every answer you gain and every clue you uncover, you only find yourself falling deeper into mystery and madness.
—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au Empire
Description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this hardback codex you'll find:


     The origins of the T'au Empire, their desire for unity through the Greater Good, and their will to expand as a species
     A detailed description T'au's caste-based society, the various Spheres of Expansion, the Septs that form the Empire, and the technological and military might of the T'au
     Background information on the Ethereals, as well as characters such as Aun'Shi, Shadowsun, and Commander Farsight
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     37 datasheets for the units that make up the T'au forces, from squads of Fire Warriors, to incredible Battlesuits, and heavily armed tanks
     Battle-forged rules that represent how the T'au wage war, from Sept Tenets, Cadre Commands, Independent Powers, as well as Bespoke Stratagems, Prototype Systems, and more.
     Crusade Rules that let you bring the Greater Good to various planets through overpowering force and subtle diplomacy
     And more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Klangraupe
Description:
Klangraupe is a memo game. The matching pairs have the same name in German, but look completely different (homonyms).

Klangraupe ist ein Memo-Spiel. Passende Paare heissen gleich, sehen aber ganz unterschiedlich aus (Homonyme).

Name: Michael Coe's Dungeon Heroes
Description:
Welcome to the Dungeon!

Two players go Head-to-Head controlling opposing sides in a game of deduction and deceit. One player controls a party of four heroes adventuring into a dungeon for treasure. The other is the Dungeon Lord who reigns over the dungeon's traps, treasures, and monsters. The heroes' party consists of a Warrior, a Cleric, a Rogue, and a Wizard, who must work together, using each of their special abilities to overcome the puzzles presented by the scheming Dungeon Lord.

—description from the back of the box

Contains Dungeon Heroes, and the Dungeon Heroes Expansion Pack.

Name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game: Hoth Limited Expansion Set
Description:
It's a bleak time for the Rebellion. The Dark forces of the Empire have driven the Rebel forces into excile on the ice planet of Hoth.

This was the first set to include images from The Empire Strikes Back. It was also the first set to introduce the mechanic of a "persona", a version of a main character with alternate abilities (e.g., Commander Luke Skywalker vs. Luke Skywalker).

Also included in this set were the immense AT-AT walkers. Another new rule was the "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" which prevents the Dark Side player from deploying his cards on the first four "marker" Hoth sites, and all interior Hoth sites; unless the Main Power Generators is "blown away".

Name: Bidding Room: Underground
Description:
As an art agent in Bidding Room: Underground, you have been employed by powerful families to represent them in a secret underground bidding room for illegal artifacts. Your task is to spend their money wisely to get goods that are worth points. Additionally, you have secret tasks and privileges that will sway how you bid.

To set up, one player takes the role of auctioneer and deals each other player a face-down agent card that includes a breakdown of all 27 artifacts in the game, while listing that player's specific privileges, such as receiving extra money for winning certain types of auctions. The auctioneer records the starting funds for each player — $40-50M depending on the player count — and sets up the artifact deck by shuffling three gift cards with the 27 artifacts. Only 10-20 items will be sold during the game, with that number being determined by the player count.

For each auction, the auctioneer reveals the item, then conducts the auction specified by that item, such as an open auction in which players write bids on their personal boards and raise them, an auctioneer bid in which the auctioneer calls out amounts and players lower their hand to drop out, a sealed bid in which agents reveal their bids simultaneously, and a second price bid in which the winner pays only the amount of the second-highest bid. If the auctioneer reveals a gift card from the deck, this gift goes to the player who won the most recent bid.

The auctioneer tracks the funds that all players have available, and an agent must track their own holdings — and everyone else's — mentally. If they win a bid for more than they have, they must sell off previously acquired items at their listed opening bids to acquire funds.

Once the specified number of items have been sold, whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Celestia: Matryoshburg Promo Tile
Description:
Matryoshburg City is an additional city for Celestia that was distributed at the Festival International des Jeux in Cannes in 2022.

Setup:

Place Matryoshburg City before the first city.

Rule:

At the end of a trip, place the aircraft on the Matryoshburg City. Each player chooses a bonus from the following three options:
* Draw an Equipment
* Discard one or more of the equipment cards in their hand and draw the same number again.
* Put a Treasure back under their pile and draw the one above it.

Then move the aircraft to Heolia (the first city) to begin a new trip, WITHOUT PICKING an Equipment card as is usually done.
Families: Theme: Floating islands in the sky

Name: Opportunity Royal Oak
Description:
Opportunity is the family fun game featuring real local businesses as its properties.  During the course of play you will buy, sell and expand businesses for profit, and face some of the same problems business owners and managers face on a daily basis.  Players should find Opportunity intriguing as they match their intuition, decision making skills and luck against that of their opponents.

—description from the box

Name: Rolling Realms: Libertalia Promo Pack
Description:
The third promo realm is inspired by Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest. It features a crew of 2-digit "pirates" that can be completed in ascending order to earn benefits.

—description from the publisher

Name: Two Trumps and a Lie
Description:
We aren't fans of not knowing fact from fiction, but sometimes you have to laugh to keep from crying. And what better place for a much-needed laugh than game night with friends?
 So we’re taking an old favorite game — Two Truths and a Lie — and updating it for truly crazy times. Can’t tell the actual Trump quotes from ones that are completely made up? SAD. But hilarious! So Make Game Night Great Again!

—description from the designer

In turn, players are given a three statements from a card, read by the player on their right, and they must guess which one was not made by Donald Trump. If they guess correctly, they keep the question card; if they answer wrongly, the player who read out the statements keeps the card. After a set number of rounds, the game ends, and the player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Doodle Face
Description:
Doodleface is a drawing game.....Potluck Style.

Instead of bringing your favorite food, bring you own interpertation of your friends facial features.

Every player gets a doodle pad and writing tool.  Shuffle the appropriate cards and "Try your best" to draw your friends well.  In future rounds themes get added for even more fun.

After all the faces are drawn, players vote on the best drawing.  Who ever was the one being drawn, wins.

Name: Dikti
Description: Dikti is a fast, fun and reflexive game! Use the letters on the cards to create words that match the categories indicated and get rid of your deck before the others do! Multiple game variations guarantee hours of fun. It's a fast-paced game starring words.

Name: Pikti
Description: Pikti is a fast, funny and reflexive game! Get rid of your deck as quickly as possible by matching the pictures on the cards to the indicated categories, and stay ahead of the others on your way to victory! Many variations of the game guarantee hours of fun. A fast-paced game with pictures in the lead role.

Name: 5 sekund junior
Description: Special Edition is another installment of the crazy and fun family game 5 Seconds Junior. In this version of the game, the questions were created by kids and parents with little and big players in mind!

Name: 5 sekund Junior 2.0: edycja 2019
Description: 5 Seconds Junior Edition 2019 is a specially prepared edition of the iconic 5 seconds game with kids in mind! Surely you can easily name 3 flavors of jam - but can you do it under time pressure? Hurry up, you only have 5 seconds

Name: 5 sekund Harry Potter
Description: Hello Wizards! A brand new, unusual version of the bestselling game 5 Seconds, set in the world of Harry Potter! Do you think you know everything about the adventures of Harry, Ron and Hermione? Do you know every corner of Hogwarts, every spell and potion ingredient? But can you do it under time pressure? You only have 5 seconds, so jog your memory and don't delay in answering.

Name: Das Gespenst in der Schule
Description:
Small escape room adventure directed to children. Your friend has disappeared, and it is rumoured that there is a ghost in your school.

A deck of 34 cards, including story and puzzles to solve along the way.

Name: Ego Pictures
Description:
Ego Pictures is the next instalment of the social game EGO. Thanks to the pictures you will get to know each other better! There is no wrong answer here! The main attraction of the game are the pictures. Choose for yourself, which picture you like best and which you like least. Which picture best represents the drawn text? The task of the other participants is to guess your choice.

Do you think that the other participants know you well?

You will soon find out!

Name: 24 Hours Escape: Lupin der Meisterdieb und der große Coup
Description:
The skills of Arsene Lupin are needed to solve an art counterfeiting case in Paris. The story follows a book format, where puzzle solutions tell you to which page you should continue. The book can be played through in a single session, or it can be split into two sessions at a recommended spot.

This escape game is full of tricks, creative ideas and criminal energy. Each puzzle is illustrated and puts the master of crime, France's most notorious crook in a brilliant light. Accompany Arsène Lupin alone or with up to four players through a unique escape game through the winding streets of old Paris.

Name: ブーケ〜花束を君に〜 (Bouquet ~Bouquet for you~)
Description:
ãƒ–ãƒ¼ã‚±ã€œèŠ±æŸã‚’å›ã«ã€œ (Bouquet ~Bouquet for you~) is a card game from Japan. Players build up a hand of flower cards to form bouquets by getting cards into sets in the style of Rummy. Pairs, runs, flushes, various card combinations work to score. Players can exchange flower cards and use a butterfly piece on the cards to add to their score.
user summary

Name: Epoca Moderna
Description: Epoca Moderna is a board game (Eurogame) of geopolitical, economic and military strategy set in the present day, where you have to rule nations as president. Through the mechanics of the month-by-month worker placement you control your statuses. Manage the economy, expand your influence, fight other countries as a wise and successful leader. Vote, import and export resources, invest in the stock exchange, construct buildings, produce materials and fulfill orders to obtain goods, increasing your territory without forgetting the morale of the population. Governments, political ideologies and official religions for an asymmetrical way of developing their own civilization at will. These and other features await you in a one-of-a-kind title! Are you ready to make your empire prosper?

Name: Puzzle Frenzy
Description:
What do a cat and a star have in common? How about cotton and a rock? Puzzle Frenzy challenges players to find the common follow-up word that ties the clues together:

star fish . . . cat fish

With another clue -- Halloween -- for cotton and rock you might figure it out:

cotton candy . . . rock candy . . . Halloween candy

Try to discover the connections between seemingly unrelated words as you build jigsaw picture clues. The first team to solve the master picture puzzle wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: 18Uruguay
Description:
An 18xx train game set in Uruguay emphasizing British investments, domestic production and European import thereof, as well as nationalization and transport of goods.

What sets it apart:
- A train roster that inludes ships
- A pickup-and-deliver mechanism
- A foreign investor mechanism
- A nationalization mechanism

—description from the designer

Name: デキタ! (DEKITA!)
Description:
ãƒ‡ã‚­ã‚¿! (DEKITA!) is a tile game from Japan. The theme is apprentice wizards learning how to form spells. But the gameplay is more abstract and somewhat language free.

The 'spells' are formed by placing tiles to construct shapes. Each tiles has four triangles, which match to neighbouring tiles to make squares. The triangles are coloured red, green and blue, or rainbow as jokers. Coloured sides must match up.

The spells are shown on theme cards, and have simple patterns of squares, such as an L shape, or a V shape. When a player has built a pattern of squares that match the shape and colour of a them card they hold, they can reveal the card as a competed spell. The first player to get to three completed spells wins the game.

A player can swap theme cards in hand for a public pool, or draw from the deck.

Players also have item cards, which allow the tiles to be changed. So a quill lets a player rotate a tile. A pocket lens lets a play change a square's colour. By careful use or tiles and items, a player can complete their spells faster.

The game was originally published in 2017, and a second edition was published in 2018 with revised card design.
user summary

Name: Draconis Invasion: Glory
Description:
Rising up from the Draconis Invasion are new hopes of GLORY. Together we might rise triumphant! The GLORY pack is a set of 3 modular mini-expansions. GLORY increases gameplay options for both the base game and Wrath expansion.

- CHAMPION cards add asymmetric powers that can be summoned at pivotal moments in the game.
- BONUS cards create changing end-game bonuses such as "Largest Army" or "Most Terror".
- INVOCATION cards shift the entire flow so that a purchased card can be Invoked - bringing it forth into your hand at your beckon call.

These additions modify the strategy without changing the core mechanics that Draconis Invasion fans love.

—description from the publisher

Name: Burned
Description:
Burned is a quick, aggressive, game of cat-and-mouse for two players. It pits The Agency, led by The Director, against a Burned Asset. The Agency must locate the Burned Asset with its team of Agents. The Asset must use its array of equipment to discover and eliminate The Director. First to die loses. Do you have what it takes to survive  in the Neon City, or will you get…Burned.

Choose between playing as The Agency or the lone Burned Asset.

As the Agency you will build your team of Agents to hunt the Asset across the city. Guess where the Burned Asset will move next and intercept them all while protecting the identity of your Director.  As the Burned Asset, you'll have to assemble a kit of weapons and tools to stay hidden while hunting for the Agency Director.

—description from the publisher

Name: DiceCulus
Description:
DiceCulus is a fun and useful game, suitable for all ages. Make your children's school studies easier, or make a one-of-a-kind party.

The rules are simple enough, so that everyone can easily grasp them, but challenging enough to keep you interested. The game develops not only logical thinking and combinability, but also communication skills and - most importantly - makes algebra FUN!

A great gift for adults and schoolkids, the game comes in a luxury packaging and with an engraved wooden dice cup. 
—description from the publisher

HOW TO PLAY:

Each player gets an empty writing sheet where they fill their results after each round.
Game consists of 4 stages and each stage has several rounds. In each round the first player draws the top card of the deck and puts it face up on the table. The card will contain a mathematical equation that could be as simple as "b-ac=" and as complex as for example "3bc/a  - df/e =".
Players then spread out the dice around the equation's variables in their sheets, roll the dice and calculate their results based on the dice values and how they put them in the equation.
Each round has a twist on the main game rules. In one of the rounds you are giving points to the other players, so your goal would then be to minimize the equation's result.

Name: Да оцелееш като родител
Description:
CONGRATULATIONS! YOU ARE NOW A PARENT!

This is where the fun begins. If you've been there before, you are in for an (un)pleasant return. If you're there now - you will be back to the daily terror instead of playing to relax. If you're about to do it - you may decide not to! Like we just said - congratulations!

—description from the publisher

How to play:
You step into the uncomfortable shoes of a parent whose sweet offspring brings him joy at the same time and seems to be trying to destroy him. All parents are different: there are businessmen and punks, politicians, managers, athletes, but they are all united by one thing - they try to survive without going crazy. Well, of course, and win. Each role has pros and cons, starts with different levels of health, sanity and money and has an individual special skill. There are two ways to win - you are either the last to be still alive or the first to get to 30 health and sanity.

MECHANICS
Before starting the game, do the following:
Give a random parent card to each player. Return the unused ones to the box.
Put cubes to indicate the current levels of sanity and health (initial values â€‹â€‹are marked on the parent cards).
Shuffle all the playing cards and create a deck. Place it in the middle of the table.
Give 4 cards to each player, as well as the starting money marked on their parent card. Three cards are then removed from the pile of cards and the top one is turned over so that it is visible to everyone.
You are now ready to begin. Each action in the game is determined by the cards you play or are already in front of you.

FIRST ROUND: The last person to have become a parent takes the three cards without bidding anything, the other players take one card from the deck. If there is no parent between you, skip the first round and start directly from the second.

EVERY NEXT ROUND: You bid for the three cards visible on the market. With shouting, cunning, insults and everything. The one who bets the most wins. There are no restrictions on bidding - you can always intervene. The one who wins the bidding takes the three cards he has bid for. The others take one card from the top of the pile. The winner of the bidding starts first and can play as many cards as he wants - without restrictions. After him is the next player in clockwise direction. When everyone is done, it's time for the next round, which repeats the second round. And so on until a winner is announced in one of two ways:
Either the last survivor or the first who reaches 30 health and sanity.

Name: Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind
Description:
What if Word War II hadn’t ended in 1945…?
What if the Manhattan Project had been delayed…?

The historical end of the Japanese Empire occurred in August 1945, before the invasion of Japan. For over 60 years, historians have debated what could have happened if a number of events had ended differently. Kamikaze 1946 proceeds from a historical base to describe what could have happened if the war had continued another year. Now you can participate in historical or what-if missions and aerial combats of WWII.

Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind accurately recreates the speed and deadliness of air-to-air combat in a fast moving game system. Based on historical combat results, aircraft characteristics, and tactics of the aces, the simple rules are easy to follow. Most missions can be completed in 1-2 hours, with 2-8 players. Each player can easily control a dozen or more aircraft. The rules and data you need are contained within, along with information on painting 1/300th scale aircraft from Luftwaffe 1946 Miniatures. Can you alter the path of history?

—description from the publisher

Name: Business Tycoon
Description:
The board game starts off with each player creating an LLC and borrowing money from the bank.

The LLC start the process of purchasing assets and either making a profit or running into liabilities. Another LLC can even aggressively take over an asset owned by a rival LLC.

The LLC that can withstand making a profit after paying the bank back the loan plus interest is the WINNER.

Great family and friends game. A fun way to introduce the topic of entrepreneurship to anyone from age 8 to age 80!

—description from the designer

Name: Na jagody: moja pierwsza gra
Description:
The heroes of the Baby Boomers and Teddy Bear series set off on a forest adventure, picking delicious berries along the way. How many berries will they be able to collect before they reach Teddy's hut? Simple rules, spacious game board and large wooden elements make the game perfect for beginning the adventure with board games. Great fun in the company of characters loved by the youngest.

Colorful board, large pieces and spacious house make the game more attractive for children. Instead of pawns, wooden characters move around the board, so children can impersonate their favorite fairy tale characters. A standard die with dots is replaced here by a multicolored wooden dice, so even toddlers who can't count yet can play their first board game.
The manual also encourages players to play the cooperative variant, in which all players collect berries to a common basket. This way, rivalry will be eliminated from the game and the little player can focus on having fun, enjoying the time spent together and teaching cooperation.

—description from the publisher

Name: Reise nach Paris
Description:
The game about traveling by train from Berlin to Paris and return.

Objective: be the first reaching start/finish stop called Potsdam Gate (Potsdamer Thor). 
Roll the die and move forward. If you land on one of the special spaces follow instructions.

The game board shows seventy one beautifully executed views (hand colored) of places along the Berlin-Paris route in 1850's (Paris  without Eiffel tower at that moment).

—user summary

Name: Rallye Interplanetaire
Description:
Rallye Interplanetaire is a French promotional space game from the Fromageries Bel company producing the popular line of Laughing Cow Cheese products.

The game is a simple roll and move mechanism where players move cardboard rockets along a path in the cosmos.  Certain spaces on the course can advance or delay the players journey to reach the moon. First to reach the moon is the winner.

The company put out a number of these promotional envelope games during the mid 1950s, with Rallye Interplanetaire being Number 7 in the series.

—user summary

Name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Board Game
Description:
Bring home the nation's favourite game show and go head-to-head with your family and friends in the race to reach £1 million.

Relive classic moments from the show and tackle the iconic money ladder using only your wits and digital lifelines (accessible through a smart device) to reach the top. But watch out! Get a question wrong and you fall back to your closest safe haven.

Do you have what it takes to win a (virtual) million?

—description from the publisher

Name: HEATED: The Spiciest Card Game
Description:
Rules are simple: Play your cards to match the color or card type to clear your hand first! With a plethora of SPECIAL CARDS to choose from, the round can change quickly!

And the great news is, it's Colorblind Friendly!

Don't have a card to play? Ask your friends to offer you a facedown card. They could be telling the truth and creating an alliance, or they could be deceiving you and creating an enemy!

HEATED is a commercial upgrade of Crazy Eights, a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Castle von Loghan: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Castle Von Loghan - Deluxe Edition is a co-op, group-decision making, survival board game that offers a unique narrative and dungeon-crawling gaming experience. The game includes several game modes, such as Story Campaign and Exploration.

The Deluxe Edition comes with an additional Campaign Mission, a brand new game board, and additional game content.

Working together as one group, the players adventure inside Castle von Loghan where they will face an array of dangers but also will find several valuable treasures.

During each turn, players have to decide where to go next, solve the secrets of the room in which they have arrived, battle the enemies protecting it, then prepare for the next encounter.

The only route to winning the game is through survival — and to survive, they need to work together.

Notable mechanisms: Sharing of health and clarity, unique narrative events that require careful listening and decision making, a ten-game-long Story Campaign that is filled with the best RPG elements one could expect, easy-to-understand card-based tactical combat that comes with a variety of outcomes.

Intro to the story:

In 1970, inside the Albatross Scientific Institute (LOS ANGELES), a group of scientists make contact with a group of hyper-intelligent beings known as the CeDI (Celestial entities from the Downing Ipsys) who claim that humankind is doomed. They have brought with them some of their advanced technology, instructing the humans to make use of it in order to evacuate the Earth which, according to the aliens, will become uninhabitable in approximately 100 years. Aided by the scientists at the Institute, the aliens unlock G.O.D.O.S., an AI they have brought with them from their galaxy. They claim G.O.D.O.S. will help all of humanity... but the aliens seem to have a personal mission linked to G.O.D.O.S. as well; one which they haven’t revealed to anyone else. On the 27th of August, G.O.D.O.S. is activated.

A council is formed and, with the help of the aliens, they begin work on Project KARR. The goal is to build at least five ships that are not only capable of carrying about 1 billion people each, but can keep them alive for hundreds of years. The KARR also serve as colonization units. The news of the aliens and of Project KARR is shared, bit by bit, with the humans, and by 2067, the ships are ready to launch.

In 2068, the ships leave earth, leaving behind all those who refuse to go.

Each ship heads towards a different point in space in the hopes of finding a suitable planet to serve as a new home. They cannot go to the aliens’ solar system, since humans can not survive such a long journey or the interstellar travel required to get there. After several years in transit, the KARR-5 ship collides with a huge meteorite and is heavily damaged. Hundreds of thousands of humans die, and many of the ship’s sectors are damaged beyond repair.

In his desperation, a certain human decides to take matters into his own hands. Owning the only copy of G.O.D.O.S., a man named Deacon Padjin, the Prime Commander of the KARR-5, uploads G.O.D.O.S. to the KARR-5 ship’s operating systems. G.O.D.O.S. takes over the entire ship!

With the help of G.O.D.O.S., the ship is saved. Humans learn how to resurrect the dead by placing the “souls” of deceased individuals into androids. The newly-resurrected individuals, known as the Resurrected, remain ignorant of their death and subsequent resurrection. This technology becomes so advanced over the years, that it is almost impossible for someone to tell if they’re human or a Resurrected. The KARR-5’s population begins growing back to its original size.

G.O.D.O.S. secretly develops a semi-functional time-machine, but after extensive testing, the results are grim: it can only send people to the past, but it can’t bring them back, and it cannot send anyone into the future. G.O.D.O.S.

A few years pass; the KARR-5 is still stationary. Deacon Padjin, who is still deeply involved with the time-travel project, develops a module that allows time-travel to the future. After managing to remove G.O.D.O.S. from the ship's systems, he uses the time-machine to escape to the past, safely, taking the AI and some other people back with him.

The remaining leaders of the KARR-5 assess the situation and, after 10 years of testing and many different iterations, manage to partially replicate the time-machine.  Having done so, about ten years later, they send a group of KarrSEC agents after Deacon and G.O.D.O.O.S. armed with a state-of-the-art tracking device, capable of following someone through time.  As there have been no changes to their timeline, it is a widely-believed hypothesis that Deacon succumbed to an untimely death, either during the jump or as a result of it.  However, the KARR-5 Council, and the KarrSEC, want to ensure that G.O.D.O.S. be dismantled so that it can’t make any modifications to the timeline, thus changing the course of History forever.

Meanwhile, the CeDI engage in secret meetings with some of the scientists from the Institute, informing them that the loss of G.O.D.O.S. will most likely have disastrous consequences. The CeDI finally reveal their true intentions: they need G.O.D.O.S. to break through a time bubble that has been placed around their planet in which an intergalactic battle is being fought. Without G.O.D.O.S., the CeDI will likely lose the battle, which could easily spread to other parts of the galaxy, a threat that none but the CeDI is prepared to face.

—description from the publisher

Name: Le Casse De Trop
Description:
Players take on the role of robbers who successfully pulled off an extremely risky job. Less than 48 hours later though, cops got them all. No doubt: someone snitched!

Each player chooses a character among the 10 available (the hacker, the demolition expert, the inside man, …), then let the cards guide you through the game and its very few rules.

The story will grow, one card, one answer at a time. Before you know it, an exciting story will unfold, filled with plots, backstories, action sequence as well as doubts.
One question remains however: did you sell out your mates or did you remain loyal?

The game ends with a Prisoner's Dilemma. Who will walk out free, who will be imprisoned for life? That's up to you to determine.

Name: Escape Room: Spillet 2
Description:
Race against the clock: you have 60 minutes to enter the correct keys on the Chrono decoder to escape. It will count down remaining time, and emit intense sounds to let you know you’re almost out of time. Can you escape?

4 exciting escape rooms with varying levels of difficulty. Work together to escape from Murder Mystery, Secret Agent, The Dentist, and Space Station.

Note: This is the Norwegian version wich contains an additional case, The Murder Mystery wich seperates it from: 
Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II)
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Track Events Mini-Expansion
Description: A mini-expansion of eight event cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign.  Each card features a unique condition that changes the game.  Select two cards at random each game.

Name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 4 (Boot) Mini-Expansion
Description:
A mini-expansion of eight additional horse cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign.  Mix the cards in with other horse cards to add more variety to the game.

This set of cards is distinguishable from other sets by the 'boot' icon on the cards.

Name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 5 (Hot Dog) Mini-Expansion
Description:
A mini-expansion of eight additional horse cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign.  This set of horse cards has a focus on the concession stand action. Mix the cards in with other horse cards to add more variety to the game.

This set of cards adds additional abilities, and is distinguishable from other sets by the 'hot dog' icon on the cards.

Name: Onimaru: Legendary Foes
Description:
The spirit-caller Kappa, the shadowmancer Kagekemono, and Ryujin, King of the Dragons, joined by three others, have emerged from the Shadow Gate to threaten the land. These Oni, along with their Hordeling followers, are hellbent on terrorizing all in their path, and they will not be easily stopped.

With these Oni components added to the game, you and your allies must work together like never before to stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

Take the ultimate challenge against these Legendary Foes, or mix up others to create your own circle of Oni.

Name: Onimaru: Heroes From Faraway Lands
Description:
The fierce fighting prowess of Jung Hae Jin and the magical mystic arts of Ichiro Hashi have been heard of from across the waters. These capable companions travel from their respective lands to join the fight against the Onimaru, contributing their skills to the battle.

With these two new heroes added to the game, you are able to take advantage of their unique abilities, or even use their various components to increase the customization options of any hero build.

Choose or create your hero wisely, and you and your allies may stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

Name: Disaster Master
Description:
A game designed to promote preparedness for natural disasters in the developing world, it was initially distributed by UNESCO in Thailand and Indonesia, but a later version was created for Pakistan as well.

Financed by Japan, it includes high-quality pieces including custom dice, a spinner, reference book and test sheets, marketed as a fun boardgame for the entire family.

The winner is whomever is able to demonstrate the best emergency preparedness in each category of disaster.

Name: The Cube: Area 51
Description:
You are a department head at Area 51, assigned to The Cube reconstruction project. Manipulate, move, tessellate, and plan as you work to rebuild the alien craft with your fellow department heads. You’re all working together to reactivate the ship, but only one of you can be the ship’s captain and interface with the companion AI! Which department will gain control over The Cube?

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Cuniculture
Description:
Cuniculture is a competitive, card-based board game, designed to be medium-weight with little luck involved. Published through 'Bring Your Own Dice' and designed by Aaron Rebelo, this board game features over 50 rabbit species with an expanding market of items.

As a rabbit enthusiast expanding your hobby into the competitive world of rabbit ownership, you begin to understand the strengths and flaws of certain breeds and the unique traits of others. Using your knowledge of each breed, it becomes your duty to utilize the short season of the summer months (rounds) to earn as much gold before the season ends. Performing the following tasks will help you become successful or slow down your competitors:

     Complete your personal goals to earn some quick points.
     Collect rabbit droppings and selling it as fertilizer for some quick cash.
     Enter your rabbit into the show to prove you have the best of the best.
     Breed your rabbits and collect handfuls of wooden rabbit tokens to sell to future enthusiasts for long-term cash.
     Bargain with your friends into lending you a hand or trading their finest rabbit.
     Visit the market to gain a larger collection of rabbits or purchase items to increase your chances at victory.


The winner is determined by the highest point value after the 6 rounds are complete, typically ranges from 30-45 minutes a game.

With bargaining incorporated into the board game, you are playing or scheming even while someone else is completing their turn, ensuring your fun does not wait for others, making time seem to hop on by.

—description from the publisher

Name: This That & Everything: Canada
Description:
This That & Everything: Canada is all "aboot" famous landmarks, iconic people, cultural influences and more. Players race to describe people, places and things related to Canada for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less! The game includes 100 double-sided cards with six subjects per card, a score pad, pencil, and 30-second sand timer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chińczyk Rodzina Treflików: moja pierwsza gra
Description: Chinese is the classic game for kids with the favorite characters from the Treflik Family cartoon! Help the Treffles arrange the balls by guiding them all to the center of the room. Watch out for other players who you are sure to meet along the way. Others are also in a hurry with their pawns, and meeting them will delay the order slightly. Roll the colored dice, move the balls and win! Have fun with the Treflik family. Thanks to the colorful dice, no counting skills are required.

Name: Kalejdoskop 15 Trefliki
Description:
Kaleidoscope 15 Games is a set of addictive games for the whole family, enriched with original pots that serve as pawns. Take part in an obstacle race, collect tokens, smash other people's pots and test your strength in a game of dice. The characters from the Treflik Family children's series are waiting for you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Down the Rabbit Hole
Description:
When a string of deaths strikes the Abernathy Retirement Community, your grandfather, Edgar Mirkowsky, contacts you to help him investigate. Edgar has always dazzled the family with fanciful stories of his past as a private detective, so you can't help but wonder if this is just another wild tale fueled by his investigative fantasies. When you arrive at the retirement facility, you suddenly feel as if you've crossed into another world. Nothing seems to make sense, and the residents all feel like characters that stepped out of a book. You wonder if you have arrived at a retirement community or tumbled Down the Rabbit Hole.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Tunnel of Love
Description:
When it was announced that real estate developer Lucas Webb was buying the abandoned Fun Town amusement park, the reception was mixed. At the project launch party held at the park, Webb wandered off with his long-time girlfriend and never returned. His body was later discovered in the old Tunnel of Love ride, and his girlfriend was nowhere to be found. Who killed Lucas Webb and why? Hold on tight, this mystery is going to be a bumpy ride!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: High Stakes
Description:
A frantic woman comes in first thing Monday morning begging you to take her case. Charlotte Moralis hasn’t heard from her husband, George Moralis, in over 24 hours. This past weekend George was on a getaway to The Velvet Curtain Casino. The last she heard from him was a voicemail telling her he was in some kind of trouble. Charlotte tried calling the police, but they wrote off her case. She insists that while George may have a gambling problem, he would never abandon his family. The casino has unsurprisingly been completely unhelpful when she called. So, you decide it’s best to go undercover and see just how high the stakes are.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Suited for Death
Description:
Dapper Gentlemen's Shop is one of the most respected men's clothing stores in all of Valley Falls.  Its reputation, however, has become tarnished after two recent murder victims were found dressed in Dapper Gentlemen's suits.  As a result, its employees have gone from being viewed as respected tailors to being viewed as the prime suspects in these gruesome killings.  Uncover what is actually going on behind the scenes at this esteemed haberdashery and find out who else might be Suited for Death!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: The Gift
Description:
As the holiday season approaches, the Valley Falls Police Department receives an early present:  three dead bodies surrounded by toys and games.  These “gifts” have been left by someone calling themselves The Tinkerer.  Now, the killer has left a note at the Will Street Detective Agency claiming that more lives are on the line.  Time is running out.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Till Death
Description:
It's the perfect day for a wedding at the illustrious McKinley Event Center until the groom
turns up dead just hours before he is set to walk down the aisle. Given that the only attendees are friends and family of
the couple, this case is bound to get messy. As if weddings weren't drama-filled enough, now you have to catch a killer
in addition to dealing with all the madness of the event itself. This gives a whole new meaning to 'Till Death Do They
Part.' Can you uncover who murdered the groom and why?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: A Stolen Star
Description:
A theft has occurred at the Valley Falls Mall. No stores were robbed. No products were
taken. Instead, the thief stole the heart of Christmas itself - the star from atop the mall’s giant Christmas tree. What at
first seems like a harmless prank becomes much more upon further investigation. Without the star, the Christmas Eve
light show cannot happen because the star is needed for all the other lights in the display to work. Not only will this lead
to some people losing their jobs, but it will also affect the light show fundraiser for the homeless of Valley Falls. Can you
find the star in time and help save Christmas?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Nick Groff's Ghost Hunt: The Cleansing of Killian House
Description:
The story of Zane Killian is a dark, bloody
stain on Valley Falls history. A noted madman, serial killer, and practitioner of the black arts, Killian was a reclusive
millionaire who had inherited a fortune from his wealthy father. Since Killian’s death in the early 1900’s, many who have
set foot in the mansion have never made it out to tell about it. Many souls that have explored the dismal hallways of
Killian House have met an untimely demise, and it is believed that Zane Killian found a way to cheat death. You have
been tasked with helping famed paranormal investigator, Nick Groff, explore the Killian House and locate Killian's secret
that binds him to the house. Your investigation may involve speaking with the spirits of Killian’s victims who are still
believed to inhabit the house. No doubt, if they are able to communicate they will be too happy to share information on
how to eradicate Killian’s spirit and see justice finally served. Cleanse the house of the evil bound spirit of Zane Killian
and restore peace to this dark corner of Valley Falls.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Double Feature: The Ventriloquist & Howl at the Moon
Description:
This featured two full games in one box!

The Ventriloquist: The police are shocked when a man walks into the police station with a bomb strapped to his chest. The mystery deepens, however, when they discover that he is simply a puppet that has been manipulated and sent there by someone calling themselves The Ventriloquist. What is The Ventriloquist's message to the Valley Falls police, and why has he taken the entire police force hostage? Don't be a dummy. Investigate this case and find out!

Howl at the Moon: Three recent deaths in Valley Falls have all thesigns of animal attacks. However, the evidence about the sort of animal that could be responsible is inconclusive. Rumors abound that the murders might have been committed by a werewolf, given that they all occurred under the  light of a full moon. The local authorities, however, aren't taking that seriously. The only connection that the three  victims share is their love and patronage of a local watering hole called Ernie's Bar. Can you determine who (or what) is responsible for the deaths of these three victims? Beware: this case may get a little hairy!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Name: Sedan 1940
Description:
"Sedan 1940" is a battalion and lower-level Operational wargame focused on the decisive action at Sedan led by Rommel in 1940, encircling the majority of the French army by driving through the Ardennes and surprising a contingent of less than stellar French divisions. The system focuses on combined arms, combat effects can vary depending on the units in a stack (also called a force). Units feature both a Primary Combat Value and a Secondary Combat Value representing different types of arms/weapons available to units, and advanced rules are available to further simulate radio issues with command and control.

Forces are activated by chit pull, activating whole divisions at a time. Each unit is allowed two basic actions or one special action. The sequence of play is unstructured, allowing movement, assaults, fire-combat and planned assaults to occur as chaotically as they did historically. Unit types range from armor, infantry, artillery, anti-tank/air, engineer, and motorized units. Units can be placed in Overwatch status allowing them to engage in Opportunity Fire using their Primary Combat Value.

Each day turn is approximately 2 hours while night turns are 4 hours for a total of 20 turns.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Joker
Description:
Experience the incredible RTP1 contest with the official Joker game. With 3 different ways to play, this board game will put your knowledge to the test with 1700 official TV show questions. Whether you play alone, in a team or train for your live participation, you'll have to go through the 12 rounds with the help of your 7 Jokers and Super Joker, in order to reach the maximum prize of €50,000

Let's play Joker!

Name: Just Tell Me What to Do
Description:
Have you ever struggled with how to make a big, tough life decision like, Should I marry a mime? Or, Should I jump into a pit of sharks for Youtube???

We get it. Life is full of hard decisions, so we created a game about the BIG questions in life and then advise you with quotes from funny famous people! In Just Tell Me What to Do, a Decision Maker reads aloud a funny decision they're making each round. Other players (the "Advisors") advise them using Advice Cards from famous comedians, authors, and that wisest of sages, Anonymous.

Each player gets 45 seconds or less to argue why their advice is best, and then the Decision Maker awards the best Advisor with the Dilemma card. You win if you get 4, but honestly, it's a party game, who's keeping score?!

Name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Malador the Mystic
Description: Malador is an ancient sorcerer from the sunken realm of Atlantis. Once a noble protector of humanity and a scholar of mystical lore, Malador has become mad with power-lust. He wants nothing more than to wield ultimate power and be acknowledged as the supreme master of the mystic arts!

Name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Lantern Jack
Description: The mysterious guardian of Lantern Hill dates back to the Revolutionary War in Freedom City. Stories claim that Lantern Jack is the restless spirit of a colonial patriot slain by a British officer when he attempted to warn the people of the city of an attack. The truth is much darker…

Name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Sub-Terra
Description: Sub-Terra is the strange realm deep beneath the surface of Earth-Prime, where the Serpent People and Morlocks engaged in a long and brutal war. It is a place of monsters, myth, and menaces spawned from both science and sorcery.

Name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Eldritch
Description: Eldrich is the Master Mage of Freedom City. An adventuring archaeologist of the 1930s, he is the reincarnation of the Atlantean mage who imprisoned Malador the Mystic millennia ago. He defends Earth-Prime from mystical threats and is an ally of the Freedom League.

Name: Drunken Spirit
Description:
Drunken Spirit is a party-drink game where you have to beat other drunken masters to be the last one standing!

Roll the dice to determine your actions and combine it with your drunken master spirit power to make your opponents drink their shots.

Their life is based on the shots elixr. When you run out of shots (drunk it all), you've been eliminated.

Name: 51st State: Uranopolis Faction
Description:
Uranopolis Faction uses Iron to get other resources as their main Action on the Faction board. It also has a defense value of 4 on all its Location types, meaning stronger protection of their Production Locations and weaker protection of the Action Locations compared to their Opponents.

—description from the publisher

				
				
					Uranopolis FactionAll Location Types have Defense Value 4.

Production:
• 3 Workers
• 2 Guns
• 1 Build Contact
• 1 Card

Actions:
• 3 Iron = 3 Build Contacts
• 1 Iron + 1 Gun = 2 Raze Contacts
• 1 Iron + 1 Fuel = 2 Deal Contacts

—faction stats entered by BGG user

Name: Apparooz: Food Truck Rooz Race
Description:
Players draw "order" cards and race around the board to visit the corresponding restaurant locations and pickup the "order" and then get back to the center of the board to deliver them.  During the game several board locations cause you to scan the card with the App to enact challenges that the players must complete to continue.

Can be played without the App, though it is recommended.

Name: Pomenia
Description:
Pomenia is a fairytale adventure game that gives you magical powers, such as social skills, emotional understanding and calmness, not to forget the motor skills.

Pomonia comes with a two sided game board that has "day" and "night" sides, which are separate games. In the "day" game players excercise their motor skills, emotional awareness and social skills, while the "night" game is more calm and silent. Day game can be played during the busy day time and the night game is meant to be played before going to sleep.

In both games players roll the dice to move and do various task, find the golden heart and save Ruttu-fairy. The player that saves the fairy is the winner.

Name: Ravipeli
Description:
"The Harness Racing Game" is quite literally that. The basic game has a lot in common with TOTO-ravi and Solvalla: for example, while the number of players is limited to 8 - with everyone driving 2 or 3 horses - any number of outside players can also participate in the totalisator betting. Just as in the other two games, the rules suggest a separate 'banker' player to handle the money and bets, presumably making the game feel more thematic.

In the actual gameplay Ravipeli is quite a bit more involved, though. The most striking difference is the innovative movement technique, where instead of simply rolling and moving players must first promise a certain number of movement points, then roll 2 or 3 dice; the more they promise the faster and farther they move, but the risk of galloping also grows ever greater. Gallops bring negative points and at certain moments in the race or if happening repeatedly, may even result in disqualification. There is also a multitude of small rules on how to drive a galloping horse, how to change  lanes voluntarily or involuntarily, how to drive in between and in front of other horses, etc., which imitate the real rules of harness racing (even including things like "Shouting at the horse, getting heated up") and lead either to disqualification or a fine that is taken from the offending driver's monetary prize, if they manage to reach the finish line.

The rules are a bit vague in who actually wins and how so in that sense this game aims to be more of a harness racing simulator than a competitive game.

Name: The 3 Little Pigs in the Wild West
Description:
Your brothers have gotten themselves in a heap of trouble with the Sheriff Wolf. He’s seen fit to toss all of them in jail while you were trying to build up a farm. Guess you’ll have to bust them out. If the Wolf finds your brothers though, he’ll toss them straight back in the clink. Get creative with your moves to get your farm built before your opponents. Will the Wolf be fooled if 3 pigs stack up in a poncho and make the rounds completing tasks?

In 3 Pigs in a Poncho, players will move their dice around the action rondel completing the action matching their die value then re-rolling for their next turn. 3 Pigs is at its core a farming game. Players use actions to build their hideout which gives them bonuses from bricks, sticks, and straw. But building has to be done with care, straw can stack on anything, but sticks only stack on sticks and bricks and bricks only stack on bricks.

Players also have an opportunity to raise livestock, building them stables and if they have a pair and an empty stable, they can get baby Unicorns, Llamas, and Cows!

Players also try to keep their fairy tale pals safe from the Big Bad Wolf Sheriff, Red Riding Hood, Billy goat gruff and Puss in Boots need your help!

Players will get to be strategic with their dice in that they can space the 3 pigs out on the rondel, but doing so makes them susceptible to being arrested by the Wolf who is also moving around the rondel. Or they can stack their piggies, less opportunity to get exactly the action they want, but less likely to be arrested also!

The game plays until a player has completed all 3 sections of their hideout. Then players score on their sheets. The game is a roll and write in that the players roll dice and mark their player sheet based on the actions they completed.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack
Description:
There are no warriors in the galaxy more storied for their prowess and ruthlessness than the Mandalorians, and their kind have seen battlefields in countless conflicts from the Clone Wars to the Galactic Civil War. Mandalorians have fought alongside nearly every faction in these struggles, whether pursuing their own agendas such as the fanatical Deathwatch or unifying with causes like the Rebel Alliance.

The Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack includes new ship and upgrade cards for Star Wars: X- Wing, allowing players to pilot their existing ships with new characters seen in The Mandalorian, Star Wars: The Clone Wars and Star Wars: Rebels. In addition to new pilots and upgrade cards useable by five factions; new tokens and obstacles are also included. Finally, the reinforcements pack also contains dials and ship tokens to convert the Fang Fighter over to the Rebel Alliance!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Terraforming Mars: New Partner Promo Card
Description:
This is the spring 2022 promo card. It is a Prelude that gives you a MC production and then you draw 2 more Preludes, pick one and discard the other.

Between March 1st and May 31st 2022, 1 copy of this promo will be added to EACH order from https://www.fryxgames.se/

X 42. New Partner is a Prelude card without tags that raises your ME production 2 step. Then it allows you to immediately draw 2 Prelude cards, play 1 of them and discard the other.

Name: 파워그리드 재충전 확장: 지도 모음집 (Power Grid Recharged – Map Collection)
Description:
This Korea-only release combines 10 fan-selected expansion maps for Power Grid into a single box. Additionally, this collection includes various promo cards that were previously unreleased in Korea!

This collection includes: 
North & South Korea
France
Italy
Central Europe
Benelux
Northern Europe
England & Ireland
The Middle East
South Africa
China

Name: KHG: Korrupte haben Geld – H.C. – Hard Core auf Ibiza
Description:
A small expansion for KHG including 20 additional cards, more cash, rules, and a booklet with background info.

"20 neue Karten, Geld und mehr, sehr schoaf"

Name: Spelled
Description:
Spelled is a deckbuilding word game between two or more magic-wielding witches and wizards. Each of your cards is a letter that can be spelled as a word to deal damage and gain powerful abilities. But each spell can hit just one target – so longer words aren’t always the best bet, giving a fair fight even if your opponent is a loquacious wordsmith...

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Doctor Strange & Clea
Description:
Stephen Strange has had many unusual encounters, but none have tested him so much as losing his connection to the arcane power of Earth. Without his magical mastery, Stephen Strange was forced to seek out new allies and a new source of power beyond the boundaries of earth. Only then could he reclaim the title of Sorcerer Supreme.

Clea is a powerful sorceress and the disciple of Sorcerer Supreme Doctor Strange. Once she inhabited the Dark Dimension, the home to the ancient evil Dormammu. Doctor Strange pulled Clea into Earth, where she learned the mystical arts from him, becoming nearly the equal of the Sorcerer Supreme in her control over magic.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition – Rook City Renegades
Description:
Sentinels of the Multiverse — Rook City Renegades expands the core game of Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition with a new mechanic (Suddenly!), 6 heroes, 9 villains, and 5 environments.

Heroes: Setback, Expatriette, Mr. Fixer, NightMist, The Harpy, Alpha

Villains: GloomWeaver, Spite, Plague Rat, Ambuscade, Kismet, The Chairman, Apex - the Wolf-King, Terrorform, The Fey-Court

Environments: Rook City, Pike Industrial Complex, The Realm of Discord, Diamond Manor, The Temple of Zhu Long

Rook City. Nighttime. The Cult of Gloom performs their dark rituals, seeking to open the way for their dread lord and master. Rumors abound of a red-masked killer lurking in the shadows. A monstrous giant rat-man-beast stalks the sewers, its terrible teeth teeming with toxins. And, above it all, The Chairman of The Organization — the largest organized crime syndicate the world has ever seen — watches the ebb and flow of his underlings, his subjects, his city. If things need a more hands-on approach, he'll send his Operative to deal with the dirty work. A few street-level heroes have teamed up, calling themselves Dark Watch. The gun-toting vigilante Expatriette has plans (and guns) for every contingency. The ancient martial artist and auto mechanic Mr. Fixer has a lifetime of experience. The cursed paranormal investigator NightMist knows countless incantations. The arcane avian apprentice The Harpy — once known as the villainous Matriarch — is now a bird of a different feather, using her magical power for good (though she still has a lot to learn about control). The hapless Setback’s luck might be bad (most of the time), but he’s the heart and soul of the team, ready to throw himself into danger without a second thought to protect others. As a team, they have a lot to offer, but they still have their work cut out for them. Perhaps they could use a little help from a new hero? Time will tell...

Name: ZOKU
Description:
Fast and Fun game where players act as Bosozoku gangs chiefs. First they send their Zokus (represented by meeples) to take control over Tokyo districts.
Then, they resolve fights between gangs by throwing the Zokus in the box !

Whoever gets more influence in Tokyo is the winner.

Name: Barnyard
Description:
Barnyard is an 18-card drafting game designed specifically for 2 players in which you will compete to corral the best combination of farm animals that you can. Manage an ever-shifting barnyard of animal cards and carefully wrangle the animals you want into your corral to score the most points and win the game!

On your turn, you'll choose an animal in the farm and use its power to manipulate the animals in the Barnyard line. Then, you'll flip that animal over and add it to the back of the line.

Next, you'll take whatever animal is currently at the front of the Barnyard line and add it to your corral.

Be careful! Some critters get along better than others, so you’ll have to carefully plan the layout of your corral if you want to score the most points and win the game.

Want to ramp up the complexity? Every copy of Barnyard comes with the free 6-card Farmers Expansion. Work towards your own secret corral objective to score even more points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Hoyuk: Special Construction Cardboards
Description:
Includes 3 green and 3 yellow cardboards (tiles).

Instructions: Before the game begins, divide the construction cardboards into 2 groups: green and yellow. Place them face up next to the game board. All players can use these cardboards, but only during the construction phase. To use such a cardboard, you must buy it with victory points. Green costs 1 victory point and yellow costs 2 victory points.

This was a KS exclusive which came packaged separately from the expansion box.

Name: Hippocrates: Game Brewer Promo Pack
Description:
Adds 3 Goal Cards with no card text. Each offers a reward to the first player who achieves that goal.

Part of a promo pack containing cards for Arkwright TCG, Rulebenders, Stroganov, Hippocrates and Paris.

Name: G.I. JOE Deck-Building Game: Shadow of the Serpent Expansion
Description:
The evil organization Cobra threatens the world with their schemes and it’s up to you to stop them!
In this Deck-Building game, you and your fellow players will lead teams of G.I. Joe soldiers on missions to stop Cobra’s dastardly plans! You have survived the Core Set Missions and are ready for more. This expansion includes new missions, main deck cards, Cobra Officers and Troopers, and a command center to build and protect!
This is an expansion. G.I Joe Deck-Building Game is required to play.

Features:
2 new missions!
New main deck cards including new Joes, utility items, weapons and more!
New Cobra Officers to confront and Cobra Troopers to defeat.
A Command Center to build and protect!
Includes a new Expert Mode card for even greater challenges!

—description from the publisher

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: The Heart of Europe
Description:
Packed full of new options, and a new city to fight over, Heart of Europe takes the battles and machinations of Vampire: The Masquerade Rivals to Prague!

This expansion does not add any new clans to the game, but rather includes new possibilities for all 10 clans currently in the game, with new Vampires, attacks, reactions, havens, and more to widen the possibilities!

—description from the publisher

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Light and Darkness
Description:
Sometimes your greatest foe is yourself. Everyone holds the potential for both great good and great evil! When it comes to the Power Rangers, nowhere is that more evident than with these powerful forces of light and darkness.
This expansion includes new characters with both hero & villain forms!
Who will triumph in this epic clash of wills and warriors?
This expansion also introduces a new type of foot soldiers, Dai Shi’s loyal Rinshi minions, as well as their elite Rinshi Beast forms.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
Series: Power Rangers Heroes of the Grid Phase 2
